Row.Text: Humanity's first Galactic Empire was falling. It had been decaying and breaking down for centuries, and only one man fully realized that fact: Hari Seldon, the last great scientist of the First Empire. It was he who had perfected psychohistory -- the science of human behavior reduced to mathematical equations. Seldon's equations told him that left to itself, the Empire would fall, and 30,000 years of human misery would elapse before a second empire could arise. However, Psychohistory also revealed that by adjusting conditions, that period of suffering could be reduced to just 1000 years.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It was to ensure this that Seldon set up two colonies of scientists known as "Foundations", the First Foundation with advanced scientific expertise, and the hidden Second Foundation, with influental Mentalic powers and the ability to guide events to the desired conclusion. Together, these Foundations possess the potential of wielding great influence over surrounding civilizations through technology, trade, religion, and direct mental influence.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Can Seldon's band of physical and mentalic scientists survive the barbarism after the Fall to lead humanity to a greater and more enduring Empire?

Hari Seldon is the intellectual hero of the Foundation Empire. In his capacity as mathematics professor at Streeling University on Trantor, he developed psychohistory, allowing him to predict the future in probabilistic terms. His ability to predict disasters is the reason behind his nickname "Raven" Seldon.
The genious behind the creation of the Foundation Empire

Foundation Academies can train Second Foundationers, who through Mentalics can suppress the will to fight of nearby enemies. Cities start with extra territory, the Pottery Tech, and can spawn powerful Foundation Scientists.
Settlers, workers, Great Prophets, and Missionaries moves twice as fast.
Provides 1 Free Foundation Scientist, as well as culture and production benefits.
Requires no [ICON_GOLD] Gold maintenance. Provides significant additional faith and culture benefits.
This extremely powerful and fast cavalry makes use of advanced Foundation technology to outrun its enemies.
All melee, mounted, and gun units have 1 extra sight.
Melee and ballistic-resistant armor, developed exclusively by the Foundation, provides a defensive bonus.
A powerful personal force-shield, providing a large defensive bonus.
A personal force-shield, providing a defensive bonus to the unit carrying it.
Excellent at exploring, a Foundation Ranger is fast, tough in combat, and carries a Foundation personal shield, providing a defensive bonus.
A Great Scientist capable of building the more powerful Foundation Academy, which generates heaps of science and culture for the Empire.
A Great Merchant who is capable of generating great influence and wealth via control of trade routes with City States. Also capable of building the Foundation Market.
Enables the Foundation to train Second Foundationers, Great Persons who possess powerful Mentalics that can suppress the will to fight of Foundation enemies.

A Second Foundationer can use Mentalics to suppress the will to fight of enemies that are within range. Foundation units that are within 5 tiles recieve a significant defensive bonus, and a milder attack bonus, with the effect growing stronger the closer the unit is to the Second Foundationer. The Second Foundationer is NOT consumed when providing this bonus. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]A Second Foundationer can also initiate a Golden Age (and will be consumed if this bonus is taken). [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]When not out charting the future history of the Foundation Empire, Second Foundationers are also not averse to working the land on Trantor as farmers. Thus, Second Foundationer units are generally able to build any improvement that a Worker can, and can usually work at least twice as fast as a Worker.

The Second Foundation was founded by Hari Seldon as a budding colony of mentalics, people with the abilities to sense and alter the emotions of others. Located at Star's End, it's purpose was to be hidden from the first Foundation and help insure success in the plan set out by Hari Seldon. A Second Foundationer has the ability to suppress the will of enemies (providing a defensive bonus to Foundation units), and can also will Foundation Workers to extra [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production capabilities.
The attack capabilities of this unit reduced by 60%.
The attack capabilities of this unit reduced by 40%.
The attack capabilities of this unit reduced by 25%.
This unit is receiving an overall 50% defense bonus.
This unit is receiving an overall 35% defense bonus.
This unit is receiving an overall 20% defense bonus.
